sentences: Christian Peder Wilhelm Geisler (28 April 1869 – 19 August 1951) was a Danish organist and composer.
He graduated at the Conservatory of Music in the years 1887-90 of, among others, Niels W. Gade, J.P.E. Hartmann and Gottfred Matthison-Hansen and studied 1895–96 with Max Bruch in Berlin.
Foraar (Spring), Poem Cycle for soprano and piano, Op. 4 (1910); words by Christian Richardt
Skolehuset (Kantate ved indvielsen af Ingrid Jespersens skole) for chorus and piano (1895)
Kantate ved indvielsen af K.F.U.M.s nye bygning for chorus and orchestra (1900)
